description: Numbers that are congruent to {6, 7} mod 8.
comments: These are the values of n for which binomial(n,6) is odd. See Maple code. - _Gary Detlefs_, Nov 29 2011
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,-1)
formula: a(n) = 8*n-a(n-1)-3 with n>1, a(1)=6. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 06 2010a(n) = 6*floor((n-1)/2) + n + 5. - _Gary Detlefs_, Nov 29 2011a(n) = a(n-1)+a(n-2)-a(n-3). G.f.: x*(6+x+x^2)/((1-x)^2*(1+x)). - _Colin Barker_, Mar 18 2012a(n) = (1-3*(-1)^n+8*n)/2. - _Colin Barker_, May 14 2012
maple: for i from 1 to 240 do if(floor((i mod 8)/6) <>0) then print(i) fi od; # _Gary Detlefs_, Nov 30 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
